p: It is known that inflammation is an evolutionarily conserved process of protection and a critical survival mechanism [ 8]. It is composed of complex sequential changes in the tissue to eliminate the initial cause of the cell injury, which may have been caused by infectious agents or substances from their metabolism (microorganisms and toxins), as well as by physical agents (radiation, burn, and trauma), or chemicals (caustic substances) [ 9, 10]. The signs of inflammation are local redness, swelling, pain, heat, and loss of function [ 7].
